a.g: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who created the heavens and the earth and made the darkness and the light. Then those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.
It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term and a specified time [known] to Him; then [still] you are in dispute.
And He is Allah, [the only deity] in the heavens and the earth. He knows your secret and what you make public, and He knows that which you earn.
And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away therefrom.
For they had denied the truth when it came to them, but there is going to reach them the news of what they used to ridicule.

Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them which We had established upon the earth as We have not established you? And We sent [rain from] the sky upon them in showers and made rivers flow beneath them; then We destroyed them for their sins and brought forth after them a generation of others.
And even if We had sent down to you, [O Muhammad], a written scripture on a page and they touched it with their hands, the disbelievers would say, "This is not but obvious magic."
And they say, "Why was there not sent down to him an angel?" But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided; then they would not be reprieved.
And if We had made him an angel, We would have made him [appear as] a man, and We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.
And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by that which they used to ridicule.
Say, "Travel through the land; then observe how was the end of the deniers."

Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth?" Say, "To Allah." He has decreed upon Himself mercy. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who will lose themselves [that Day] do not believe.
And to Him belongs that which reposes by night and by day, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

Say, "Is it other than Allah I should take as a protector, Creator of the heavens and the earth, while it is He who feeds and is not fed?" Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to be the first [among you] who submit [to Allah] and [was commanded], 'Do not ever be of the polytheists.' "
Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإذا قال ﴿ إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم ﴾ ولم يكن خائفا كان حاكيا
Indeed, if he says, "Indeed, I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a Great Day [yawm 'azim]," and he is not fearful, then he is merely mimicking [hakiya].

a.g: He from whom it is averted that Day - [Allah] has granted him mercy. And that is the clear attainment.
And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
And He is the subjugator over His servants. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted [with all].

Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?" Say, "Allah is witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you [truly] testify that with Allah there are other deities?" Say, "I will not testify [with you]." Say, "Indeed, He is but one God, and indeed, I am free of what you associate [with Him]."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى ﴿ وأوحى إليّ هذا القرآن لأنذركم به ومن بلغ ﴾ قال محمد بن كعب القرظي من بلغه القرآن فكأنما كلمه الله وإذا قدر ذلك لم يتخذ دراسة القرآن عمله بل يقرؤه كما يقرأ العبد كتاب مولاه الذي كتبه إليه ليتأمله ويعمل بمقتضاه.
Indeed, I have revealed this Qur'an to me to warn you thereby and whoever it reaches [wa-man balagha]. Muhammad ibn Ka'b al-Qurazi said: Whoever the Qur'an reaches, it is as if Allah has spoken to him. And when this is realized, he does not take the mere study [dirasah] of the Qur'an as his deed [amal]. Rather, he recites it as a servant recites the letter of his Master [Mawla] which He wrote to him, to contemplate it [yata'ammaluhu] and act in accordance with its requirement [muqtadahu].

a.g: Those to whom We have given the Scripture recognize it as they recognize their [own] sons. Those who will lose themselves [in the Hereafter] do not believe.
And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together; then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim [with Him]?"
Then there will be no [excuse upon] examination except they will say, "By Allah, our Lord, we were not those who associated."
See how they will lie about themselves. And lost from them will be what they used to invent.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فالجواب أن هذا الاستثناء صحيح وله أربعة أوجه وجهان مستندان إلى الشك لا في أصل الإيمان ولكن في خاتمته أو كماله ووجهان لا يستندان إلى الشك. الوجه الأول: الذي لا يستند إلى معارضة الشك الاحتراز من الجزم خيفة ما فيه من تزكية النفس قال الله تعالى: ﴿ فلا تزكوا أنفسكم ﴾ {} وقال: ﴿ ألم تر إلى الذين يزكون أنفسهم ﴾ {} وقال تعالى: ﴿ انظر كيف يفترون على الله الكذب ﴾ {} وقيل لحكيم ما الصدق القبيح فقال ثناء المرء على نفسه والإيمان من أعلى صفات المجد والجزم تزكية مطلقة وصيغة الاستثناء كأنها ثقل من عرف التزكية كما يقال للإنسان أنت طبيب أو فقيه أو مفسر فيقول نعم إن شاء الله لا في معرض التشكيك ولكن لإخراج نفسه عن تزكية نفسه فالصيغة صيغة الترديد والتضعيف لنفس الخبر ومعناه التضعيف اللازم من لوازم الخبر وهو التزكية وبهذا التأويل لو سئل عن وصف ذم لم يحسن الاستثناء.
Indeed, this exception [istithna'] is valid, and it has four aspects. Two aspects are based on doubt [shakk], not in the root of faith [iman] but in its conclusion or its perfection, and two aspects are not based on doubt. The first aspect, which is not based on opposing doubt, is precaution against certainty [jazm] out of fear of what it contains of self-praise [tazkiyat al-nafs]. Allah, the Exalted, said: "So do not claim purity for yourselves" [53:32]. And He said: "Have you not seen those who claim purity for themselves?" [4:49]. And the Exalted said: "See how they invent lies about Allah" [4:50]. And it was said to a wise man, "What is ugly truthfulness?" He said, "A person's praise of himself." And faith [iman] is among the highest attributes of glory, and certainty [jazm] is absolute self-praise [tazkiya mutlaqa]. And the form of the exception is as if it is a burden for one who knows self-praise [tazkiya]; as it is said to a person, "You are a doctor, or a jurist, or an exegete," and he says, "Yes, if Allah wills," not in the manner of casting doubt, but to remove himself from praising himself. So the form is the form of hesitation and weakening of the report itself, and its meaning is the weakening necessitated by the prerequisites of the report, which is self-praise [tazkiya]. And by this interpretation, if he were asked about a blameworthy attribute, the exception would not be appropriate.

a.g: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if they should see every sign, they will not believe in it. Even when they come to you arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, "This is not but legends of the former peoples."
And they prevent [others] from him and are [themselves] remote from him. And they do not destroy except themselves, but they perceive [it] not.
If you could but see when they are made to stand before the Fire and will say, "Oh, would that we could be returned [to life on earth] and not deny the signs of our Lord and be among the believers."
But what they concealed before has [now] appeared to them. And even if they were returned, they would return to that which they were forbidden; and indeed, they are liars.
And they say, "There is none but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected."

If you could but see when they will be made to stand before their Lord. He will say, "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will [then] say, "So taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve."

Those will have lost who deny the meeting with Allah, until when the Hour [of resurrection] comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, "Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it," while they bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
And the worldly life is not but amusement and diversion; but the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah, so will you not reason?
We know that you, [O Muhammad], are saddened by what they say. And indeed, they do not call you untruthful, but it is the verses of Allah that the wrongdoers reject.

And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of Allah. And there has certainly come to you some information about the [previous] messengers.

And if their evasion is difficult for you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign, [then do so]. But if Allah had willed, He would have united them upon guidance. So never be of the ignorant.
Only those who hear will respond. But the dead - Allah will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
And they say, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allah is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know."

And there is no creature on [or within] the earth or bird that flies with its wings except [that they are] communities like you. We have not neglected in the Register a thing. Then unto their Lord they will be gathered.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال أبو هريرة فى قوله عز وجل ﴿ وما من دابة فى الأرض ولا طائر يطير بجناحيه إلا أمم أمثالكم ﴾ أنه يحشر الخلق كلهم يوم القيامة البهائم والدواب والطير وكل شىء فيبلغ من عدل الله تعالى أن يأخذ للجماء من القرناء ثم يقول كونى ترابا فذلك حين يقول الكافر يا ليتنى كنت ترابا فكنت أنت يا مسكين فى يوم ترى صحيفتك خالية عن حسنات طال فيها تعبك فتقول أين حسناتي فيقال نقلت إلى صحيفة خصمائك وترى صحيفتك مشحونة بسيئات طال فى الصبر عنها نصبك واشتد بسبب الكف عنها عناؤك فتقول يا رب هذه سيئات ما قارفتها قط فيقال هذه سيئات القوم الذين اغتبتهم وشتمتهم وقصدتهم بالسوء وظلمتهم فى المبايعة والمجاورة والمخاطبة والمناظرة والمذاكرة والمدارسة وسائر أصناف المعاملة.
Indeed, Abu Hurairah said concerning His Mighty and Majestic statement, **"And there is no creature on the earth nor a bird that flies with its wings, but that they are communities like you"** [6:38], that all creation will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection—the beasts, the animals, the birds, and everything. The justice [‘adl] of God, Exalted is He, will reach such a degree that He will exact retribution for the hornless from the horned. Then He will say, "Be dust!" And that is when the disbeliever will say, "I wish I were dust!" [78:40]. So you, O wretched one, on a day when you see your record [sahifah] empty of good deeds, despite the long toil [ta’ab] you endured for them, and you will say, "Where are my good deeds?" It will be said: "They were transferred to the record of your adversaries." And you will see your record laden with evil deeds, despite the long hardship [nusb] you endured in being patient [sabr] from them and the intense effort [‘ana’] you exerted in restraining yourself from them. And you will say, "O Lord, these are evil deeds I never committed!" It will be said: "These are the evil deeds of the people whom you backbit, whom you insulted, whom you intended harm, and whom you wronged in transactions, in neighborly relations, in speech, in debate, in discussion, in study, and in all other types of dealings."

a.g: But those who deny Our verses are deaf and dumb within darknesses. Whomever Allah wills - He leaves astray; and whomever He wills - He puts him on a straight path.
Say, "Have you considered: if there came to you the punishment of Allah or there came to you the Hour - is it other than Allah you would invoke, if you should be truthful?"
No, it is Him [alone] you would invoke, and He would remove that for which you invoked Him if He willed, and you would forget what you associate [with Him].
And We have already sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
Then why, when Our punishment came to them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made attractive to them that which they were doing.

So when they forgot that by which they had been reminded, We opened to them the doors of every [good] thing until, when they rejoiced in that which they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were [then] in despair.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ثم قرأ قوله تعالى: ﴿ فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به فتحنا عليهم أبواب كل شىء ﴾ {}[104]) يعنى لما تركوا ما أمروا به فتحنا عليهم أبواب الخير حتى إذا فرحوا بما أوتوا أى بما أعطوا من الخير أخذناهم بغتة.
Indeed, when they forgot [نسوا] what they had been reminded of, We opened for them the gates of every thing [أبواب كل شىء] — meaning, when they abandoned what they had been commanded, We opened for them the gates of good [أبواب الخير] — until, when they rejoiced in what they were given, that is, in what they were granted of good, We seized them suddenly [بغتة].

a.g: So the people that committed wrong were eliminated. And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should take away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allah could bring them [back] to you?" Look how we diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
Say, "Have you considered: if the punishment of Allah should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"
And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
But those who deny Our verses - the punishment will touch them for their defiant disobedience.

Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not tell you that I have the depositories [containing the provision] of Allah or that I know the unseen, nor do I tell you that I am an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me." Say, "Is the blind equivalent to the seeing? Then will you not give thought?"
And warn by the Qur'an those who fear that they will be gathered before their Lord - for them besides Him will be no protector and no intercessor - that they might become righteous.

And do not send away those who call upon their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to send them away, you would [then] be of the wrongdoers.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى ولا تطرد الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه والمراد بتلك الإرادة هى النية.
And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord [rabbihim] in the morning and the evening, desiring His Countenance [wajhahu]. And the meaning of that desire [al-iradah] is the intention [niyyah].

a.g: And thus We have tried some of them through others that the disbelievers might say, "Is it these whom Allah has favored among us?" Is not Allah most knowing of those who are grateful?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال تعالى يصف قول قريش "أهؤلاء من الله عليهم من بيننا" كالاستحقار لهم والأنفة منهم.
Indeed, God the Exalted describes the saying of Quraysh, "Are these the ones whom God has favored from among us?" as a form of belittling them and feeling aversion from them.

a.g: And when those come to you who believe in Our verses, say, "Peace be upon you. Your Lord has decreed upon Himself mercy: that any of you who does wrong out of ignorance and then repents after that and corrects himself - indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل: " وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم " وأمره بالإعراض عن غيرهم، فقال: " وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم " حتى قال: " فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين " وقال تعالى: " واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي ". فكذلك الانبساط والإدلال يحتمل من بعض العباد دون بعض.
Indeed, the Mighty and Majestic has said: "And when those who believe in Our signs [ayatina] come to you, say: 'Peace be upon you.'" And He commanded him to turn away from others, saying: "And when you see those who engage in vain discourse about Our signs [ayatina], then turn away from them," until He said: "So do not sit after the Remembrance [dhikr] with the wrongdoing people [al-qawm al-zalimin]." And the Exalted has said: "And keep yourself patient with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening." Thus, likewise, expansiveness [al-inbisat] and intimate boldness [al-idlal] are permissible from some worshippers ['ibad] and not from others.

a.g: And thus do We detail the verses, and [thus] the way of the criminals will become evident.
Say, "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you invoke besides Allah." Say, "I will not follow your desires, for I would then have gone astray, and I would not be of the [rightly] guided."

Say, "Indeed, I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have that for which you are impatient. The decision is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of deciders."
Say, "If I had that for which you are impatient, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers."

And with Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. And no grain is there within the darknesses of the earth and no moist or dry [thing] but that it is [written] in a clear record.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فهذه أسرار القرآن ولا تتناهى أمثال هذه الأسرار في القرآن " ولا رطب ولا يابس إلا في كتاب مبين " ولذلك قال ابن مسعود رضي الله عنه: نوروا القرآن والتمسوا غرائب ففيه علم الأولين والآخرين، وهو كما قال، ولا يعرفه إلا من طال في آحاد كلماته فكره وصفا له فهمه حتى تشهد له كل كلمة منه بأنه كلام جبار قاهر مليك قادر وأنه خارج عن حد استطاعة البشر.
Indeed, these are the secrets [asrar] of the Qur'an, and such secrets [asrar] in the Qur'an are without end: "And not a thing moist or dry, but it is in a clear Book." And for this reason, Ibn Mas'ud, may God be pleased with him, said: Illuminate yourselves with the Qur'an and seek its wonders [ghara'ib], for within it is the knowledge ['ilm] of the first and the last. And it is as he said. And none knows it except he who has prolonged his reflection [fikr] and his description [wasf] of the meaning of its individual words, until every word of it bears witness for him that it is the speech of a Mighty, Overpowering, Sovereign, and Powerful One, and that it is beyond the limit of human capability.

a.g: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be fulfilled. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
أوصيك بحفظ نفسك من نفسك وأذكرك قوله تعالى "وهو الذي يتوفاكم بالليل ويعلم ما جرحتم بالنهار"
I counsel you to guard your self [nafs] from your self [nafs], and I remind you of His saying, the Most High: "And He is the One who takes your souls [anfus] by night and knows what you have committed by day."

a.g: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers take him, and they do not fail [in their duties].
Then they His servants are returned to Allah, their true Lord. Unquestionably, His is the judgement, and He is the swiftest of accountants.

Say, "Who rescues you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring [aloud] and privately, 'If He should save us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful.' "
Say, "It is Allah who saves you from it and from every distress; then you [still] associate others with Him."

Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another." Look how We diversify the signs that they might understand.
But your people have denied it while it is the truth. Say, "I am not over you a manager."
For every happening is a finality; and you are going to know.

And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan should cause you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولا تستبعدون رضاه عن العبد بما يغضب به على غيره مهما اختلف مقامهما، ففي القرآن تنبيهات على هذه المعاني لو فطنت وفهمت، فجميع قصص القرآن تنبيهات لأولي البصائر والأبصار حتى ينظروا إليها بعين الاعتبار، فإنما هي عند ذوي الاعتبار من الأسماء. فأول القصص: قصة آدم عليه السلام وإبليس أما تراهما كيف اشتركا في اسم المعصية والمخالفة ثم تباينا في الاجتباء والعصمة. أما إبليس فأبلس عن رحمته، وقيل إنه من المبعدين. وأما آدم عليه السلام فقيل فيه " وعصى آدم ربه فغوى ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى ". وقد عاتب الله نبيه ﭬ في الإعراض عن عبد والإقبال على عبد، وهما في العبودية سيان ولكن في الحال مختلفان، فقال: " وأما من جاءك يسعى وهو يخشى فأنت عنده تلهى "، وقال في الآخر: " أما من استغنى فأنت له تصدى " وةكذلك أمره بالقعود مع طائفة، فقال عز وجل: " وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم " وأمره بالإعراض عن غيرهم، فقال: " وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم " حتى قال: " فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين " وقال تعالى: " واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي ". فكذلك الانبساط والإدلال يحتمل من بعض العباد دون بعض.
And do not deem it improbable that He is pleased with a servant [‘abd] by that which angers Him from another, however much their stations [maqām] may differ. For in the Qur'an are intimations [tanbīhāt] of these meanings, if you were to be discerning and understand. Indeed, all the narratives [qiṣaṣ] of the Qur'an are intimations for those of insight [baṣā’ir] and vision [abṣār], that they may look upon them with the eye of consideration [i‘tibār], for they are, in the sight of those possessed of consideration, among the signs [āyāt]. The first of the narratives: the story of Adam, peace be upon him, and Iblis. Do you not see how they shared in the name of disobedience [ma‘ṣiyah] and opposition [mukhālafah], yet they differed in being chosen [ijtibā’] and protected [‘iṣmah]? As for Iblis, he was despaired of His mercy [raḥmah], and it is said he is among the banished [mub‘adīn]. As for Adam, peace be upon him, it was said concerning him: "And Adam disobeyed [‘aṣā] his Lord and went astray [ghawā]. Then his Lord chose him [ijtabāhu], turned to him [tāba ‘alayhi], and guided him [hadā]." And God reproached His Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, for turning away from one servant and turning towards another, though they are equal in servitude [‘ubūdiyyah] but different in state [ḥāl]. He said: "But as for he who came to you striving [yas‘ā] and fearing [yakhshā], you are distracted from him." And He said of the other: "But as for he who considers himself self-sufficient [istaghnā], to him you attend." And likewise, He commanded him to sit with a group, for the Mighty and Majestic said: "And when those who believe in Our signs come to you, say, 'Peace be upon you.'" And He commanded him to turn away from others, saying: "And when you see those who engage in idle talk about Our signs, then turn away from them," until He said: "So do not sit, after the reminder, with the wrongdoing people." And He, exalted is He, said: "And restrain yourself with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening." Thus, likewise, expansiveness [inbisāṭ] and intimate boldness [idlāl] are permissible from some servants [‘ibād] and not from others.

a.g: And those who fear Allah are not held accountable for the disbelievers at all, but [only for] a reminder - that perhaps they will fear Him.

And leave those who take their religion as amusement and diversion and whom the worldly life has deluded. But remind with the Qur'an, lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have other than Allah no protector and no intercessor. And if it should offer every compensation, it would not be taken from it. Those are the ones who are given to destruction for what they have earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى: (وذر الذين اتخذوا دينهم لعبا ولهوا) (الأنعام: 70). فكل ما أحدث بعد الصحابة رضي الله عنهم مما جاوز قدر الضرورة والحاجة فهو من اللعب واللهو.
Indeed, leave those who have taken their religion [din] as play [la'ib] and diversion [lahw] (Al-An'am: 70). So, every innovation [muhdath] that occurred after the Companions, may God be pleased with them, which exceeded the measure of necessity [darurah] and need [hajah], then it is from play [la'ib] and diversion [lahw].

a.g: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be turned back on our heels after Allah has guided us? [We would then be] like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us.' " Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds.
And to establish prayer and fear Him." And it is He to whom you will be gathered.

And it is He who created the heavens and earth in truth. And the day He says, "Be," and it is, His word is the truth. And His is the dominion [on] the Day the Horn is blown. [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed; and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال أبو عبد الله الوراق لو كان عليك مثل عدد القطر وزبد البحر ذنوبا لمحيت عنك إذا دعوت ربك بهذا الدعاء مخلصا إن شاء الله تعالى اللهم إني أستغفرك من كل ذنب تبت إليك منه ثم عدت فيه وأستغفرك من كل ما وعدتك به من نفسي ولم أوف لك به وأستغفرك من كل عمل أرد به وجهك فخالطه غيرك وأستغفرك من كل نعمة أنعمت بها علي فاستعنت بها على معصيتك وأستغفرك يا عالم الغيب والشهادة من كل ذنب أتيته في ضياء النهار وسواد الليل في ملأ أو خلاء وسر وعلانية يا حليم.
Indeed, Abu Abdullah Al-Warraq said: If you had sins equal to the number of raindrops and the foam of the sea, they would be erased from you if you called upon your Lord with this supplication sincerely, if Allah the Exalted wills. O Allah, indeed I seek Your forgiveness [astaghfiruka] for every sin I repented to You from, then returned to it. And I seek Your forgiveness for everything I promised You from my soul, yet did not fulfill for You. And I seek Your forgiveness for every deed I intended by it Your Face [wajhika], yet something other than You became mixed with it. And I seek Your forgiveness for every blessing [ni'mah] You bestowed upon me, which I then used as aid in disobeying You. And I seek Your forgiveness, O Knower of the unseen and the seen ['Alim al-Ghayb wa al-Shahadah], for every sin I committed in the brightness of day and the darkness of night, in public or in private, in secret and openly, O Forbearing One [Ya Halim].

a.g: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, "Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people to be in manifest error."
And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith]
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلم مدح الله تعالى إبراهيم بقوله وكذلك نرى إبراهيم ملكوت السموات والأرض لا بل كل ما يدرك بحاسة البصر فالقرآن يعبر عنه بالملك والشهادة وما غاب عن الأبصار فيعبر عنه بالغيب والملكوت والله تعالى عالم الغيب والشهادة وجبار الملك والملكوت ولا يحيط أحد بشىء من علمه إلا بما شاء وهو عالم الغيب فلا يظهر على غيبه أحدا إلا من ارتضى من رسول
Indeed, why did God the Exalted praise Abraham [Ibrahim] with His saying, "And thus did We show Abraham the kingdom [mulk] of the heavens and the earth"? Nay, rather, everything that is perceived by the sense of sight [basar], the Qur'an expresses it with 'the dominion' [mulk] and 'the witnessed' [shahada]. And that which is absent from sights [absar] is expressed with 'the unseen' [ghayb] and 'the kingdom' [malakut]. And God the Exalted is the Knower of the unseen [ghayb] and the witnessed [shahada], the Compeller of the dominion [mulk] and the kingdom [malakut]. And no one encompasses anything of His knowledge [ilm] except what He wills. And He is the Knower of the unseen [ghayb], so He does not reveal His unseen [ghayb] to anyone except a messenger [rasul] whom He has approved.

a.g: So when the night covered him [with darkness], he saw a star. He said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "I like not those that disappear."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفرقة أخرى جاوزوا هؤلاء ولم يلتفتوا إلى ما يفيض عليهم من الأنوار في الطريق ولا إلا ما تيسر لهم من العطايا الجزيلة ولم يعرجوا على الفرح بها والالتفات إليها جادين في السير حتى قاربوا فوصلوا إلى حد القربة إلى الله تعالى، فظنوا أنهم قد وصلوا إلى الله فوقفوا وغلطوا فإن لله تعالى سبعين حجاباً من نور لا يصل السالك إلى حجاب من تلك الحجب في الطريق إلا ويظن أنه قد وصل. وإليه الإشارة بقول إبراهيم عليه السلام إذ قال الله تعالى إخباراً عنه "فلما جن الليل رأى كوكباً قال هذا ربي" وليس المعنى به هذه الأجسام المضيئة فإنه كان يراها في الصغر ويعلم أنها ليست آلهة وهي كثيرة وليست واحداً، والجهال يعلمون أن الكوكب ليس بإله فمثل إبراهيم عليه السلام لا يغره الكوكب الذي لا يغر السوادية. ولكن المراد به أنه نور من الأنوار التي هي من حجب الله عز وجل وهي على طريق السالكين، ولا يتصور الوصول إلى الله تعالى إلا بالوصول إلى هذه الحجب، وهي حجب من نور بعضها أكبر من بعض وأصظمها الشمس وبينهما رتبة القمر، فلم يزل إبراهيم عليه السلام لما رأى ملكوت السموات حيث قال تعالى "وكذلك نرى إبراهيم ملكوت السموات والأرض" ويصل إلى نور بعد نور ويتخيل إليه في أول ما كان يلقاه أنه قد وصل، ثم كان يكشف له أن وراءه أمراً فيترقى إليه ويقول: قد وصلت فيكشف له ما وراءه حتى وصل إلى الحجاب الأقرب الذي لا وصول إلا بعده، فقال "هذا أكبر" فلما ظهر له أنه مع عظمه غير خال عن الهوى في حضيض النقص والانحطاط عن ذروة الكمال "قال لا أحب الآفلين - إلى أن قال - إني وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السموات والأرض".
Indeed, another group surpassed these and did not turn their attention to the lights [anwar] that overflow upon them on the path, nor to the abundant gifts made easy for them, and they did not linger over rejoicing in them or turning towards them, earnest in their journey until they drew near and reached the limit of proximity [qurb] to God, the Exalted. So they thought they had reached God, and they stopped, and they erred. For God, the Exalted, has seventy veils [hijab] of light [nur]; the wayfarer [salik] does not reach a veil from those veils on the path except that he thinks he has arrived. And the allusion to this is in the saying of Abraham, peace be upon him, when God, the Exalted, said, narrating from him: "When the night grew dark, he saw a star; he said, 'This is my Lord.'" And the meaning is not these luminous bodies, for he used to see them in his youth and knew they were not gods, and they are many, not one. The ignorant know that the star is not a god, so one like Abraham, peace be upon him, would not be deceived by a star that does not deceive the common folk. Rather, what is intended is that it is a light [nur] from the lights [anwar] that are among the veils [hujub] of God, the Mighty and Majestic, and they are on the path of the wayfarers [salikin]. And arrival [wusul] to God, the Exalted, is not conceivable except by arriving at these veils [hujub]. And they are veils [hujub] of light [nur], some greater than others, and the greatest of them is the sun, and between them is the rank of the moon. So Abraham, peace be upon him, did not cease—when he saw the kingdom [malakut] of the heavens, as God, the Exalted, said: "And thus did We show Abraham the kingdom [malakut] of the heavens and the earth"—and he reached a light [nur] after a light [nur], and it would appear to him at the first of what he encountered that he had arrived. Then it would be unveiled to him that beyond it was a matter, so he would ascend to it and say: "I have arrived," then what was beyond it would be unveiled to him, until he reached the nearest veil [hijab], beyond which there is no arrival [wusul]. So he said, "This is greater." Then when it became clear to him that it, despite its greatness, was not free from setting, in the lowliness of deficiency and decline from the pinnacle of perfection, he said, "I do not love those that set"—until he said—"Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth."

a.g: And when he saw the moon rising, he said, "This is my lord." But when it set, he said, "Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray."
And when he saw the sun rising, he said, "This is my lord; this is greater." But when it set, he said, "O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وإليه الإشارة بقول إبراهيم عليه السلام إذ قال الله تعالى إخباراً عنه "فلما جن الليل رأى كوكباً قال هذا ربي" وليس المعنى به هذه الأجسام المضيئة ولكن المراد به أنه نور من الأنوار التي هي من حجب الله عز وجل وهي على طريق السالكين، ولا يتصور الوصول إلى الله تعالى إلا بالوصول إلى هذه الحجب، وهي حجب من نور بعضها أكبر من بعض وأصغر النيرات الكوكب فاستعير له لفظه وأعظمها الشمس وبينهما رتبة القمر، فلم يزل إبراهيم عليه السلام لما رأى ملكوت السموات حيث قال تعالى "وكذلك نرى إبراهيم ملكوت السموات والأرض" ويصل إلى نور بعد نور ويتخيل إليه في أول ما كان يلقاه أنه قد وصل، ثم كان يكشف له أن وراءه أمراً فيترقى إليه ويقول: قد وصلت فيكشف له ما وراءه حتى وصل إلى الحجاب الأقرب الذي لا وصول إلا بعده، فقال "هذا أكبر" فلما ظهر له أنه مع عظمه غير خال عن الهوى في حضيض النقص والانحطاط عن ذروة الكمال "قال لا أحب الآفلين - إلى أن قال - إني وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السموات والأرض".
Indeed, to this is the allusion in the saying of Abraham, peace be upon him, when God Almighty said, reporting from him: "When the night grew dark, he saw a star. He said, 'This is my Lord [Rabb].'" And the meaning is not these luminous bodies, but rather what is intended by it is that it is a light [nūr] from among the lights [anwār] which are from the veils [ḥujub] of God, Mighty and Majestic, and they are upon the path of the wayfarers [sālikīn]. And one cannot conceive of arrival [wuṣūl] to God Almighty except by arriving at these veils [ḥujub], and they are veils [ḥujub] of light [nūr], some of them greater than others. And the smallest of the luminous bodies is the star, so its term was borrowed for it, and the greatest of them is the sun, and between them is the rank of the moon. And Abraham, peace be upon him, did not cease—when he saw the dominion [malakūt] of the heavens, as God Almighty said: "And thus did We show Abraham the dominion [malakūt] of the heavens and the earth"—and he would arrive at a light [nūr] after a light [nūr], and it would be imagined by him at the first of what he would encounter that he had arrived [waṣala]. Then it would be unveiled [kushifa] to him that beyond it was a matter, so he would ascend to it and say: "I have arrived," then it would be unveiled [kushifa] to him what was beyond it, until he arrived at the nearest veil [ḥijāb] beyond which there is no arrival [wuṣūl]. So he said, "This is greater." Then when it became apparent to him that it, despite its greatness, was not free from setting, in the lowliness of deficiency and descent from the pinnacle of perfection, he said, "I do not love those that set"—until he said—"Indeed, I have turned my face [wajh] to He who created the heavens and the earth."

a.g: Indeed, I have turned my face toward He who created the heavens and the earth, inclining toward truth, and I am not of those who associate others with Allah."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فالكمال الأول في اللفظ أن يحترز عن صريح اللفظ وعن المعاريض أيضا إلا عند الضرورة والكمال الثاني أن يراعي معنى الصدق في ألفاظه التى يناجي بها ربه كقوله (وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السموات والأرض) فإن قلبه إن كان منصرفا عن الله تعالى مشغولا بأماني الدنيا وشهواته فهو كذب وكقوله (إياك نعبد) وقوله (أنا عبد الله) فإنه إذا لم يتصف بحقيقة العبودية وكان له مطلب سوى الله لم يكن كلامه صدقا ولو طولب يوم القيامة بالصدق في قوله أنا عبد الله لعجز تحقيقه فإنه إن كان عبدا لنفسه أو عبدا لدنيا أو عبدا لشهواته لم يكن صادقا في قوله. وكل ما تقيد العبد به فهو عبد له كما قال عيسى عليه السلام يا عبيد الدنيا وقال نبينا صلى الله عليه وسلم (تعس عبد الدنيا وتعس عبد الدرهم وعبد الحلة وعبد الخميصة) فسمى كل من تقيد قلبه بشىء عبدا له وإنما العبد الحق لله عز وجل من أعتق أولا من غير الله تعالى فصار حرا مطلقا فإذا تقدمت هذه الحرية صار القلب فارغا فحلت فيه العبودية لله فتشغله بالله وبمحبته وتقيد باطنه وظاهره بطاعته فلا يكون له مراد إلا الله تعالى ثم تجاوز هذا إلى مقام آخر أسنى منه يسمى الحرية وهو أن يعتق أيضا عن إرادة الله من حيث هو بل يقنع بما يريد الله له من تقريب أو إبعاد فتفنى إرادته في إرادة الله تعالى. وهذا عبد عتق عن غير الله فصار حرا ثم عاد وعتق عن نفسه فصار حرا وصار مفقودا لنفسه موجودا لسيده ومولاه إن حركة تحرك وإن سكنه سكن وإن ابتلاه رضي لم يبق فيه متسع لطلب والتماس واعتراض بل هو بين يدي الله كالميت بين يدي الغاسل وهذا منتهى الصدق في العبودية لله تعالى فالعبد الحق هو الذي وجوده لمولاه لا لنفسه وهذه درجة الصديقين. وأما الحرية عن غير الله فدرجات الصادقين وبعدها تتحقق العبودية لله تعالى وما قبل هذا فلا يستحق صاحبه أن يسمى صادقا ولا صديقا فهذا هو معنى الصدق في القول.
Indeed, likewise is His saying, "I have turned my face [wajh] toward He who created the heavens and the earth." For if his heart [qalb] is turned away from God, exalted is He, preoccupied with the hopes [amani] of the world [dunya] and its desires [shahawat], then it is a lie.

a.g: And his people argued with him. He said, "Do you argue with me concerning Allah while He has guided me? And I fear not what you associate with Him [and will not be harmed] unless my Lord should will something. My Lord encompasses all things in knowledge; then will you not remember?

And how should I fear what you associate while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has not sent down to you any authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?
They who believe and do not mix their belief with injustice - those will have security, and they are [rightly] guided.
And that was Our [conclusive] argument which We gave Abraham against his people. We raise by degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال عز وجل وتلك حجتنا آتيناها إبراهيم على قومه وقال تعالى في قصة فرعون وما رب العالمين إلى قوله أولوا جئتك بشيء مبين وعلى الجملة فالقرآن من أوله إلى آخره محاجة مع الكفار فعمده أدلة المتكلمين في التوحيد قوله تعالى لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا وفي النبوة وإن كنتم في ريب مما نزلنا على عبدنا فأتوا بسورة من مثله وفي البعث قل يحييها الذي أنشأها أول مرة إلى غير ذلك من الآيات والأدلة ولم تزل الرسل صلوات الله عليهم يحاجون المنكرين ويجادلونهم قال تعالى: ﴿ وجادلهم بالتي هي أحسن ﴾ {} فالصحابة رضي الله عنهم أيضا كانوا يحاجون المنكرين ويجادلون ولكن عند الحاجة وكانت الحاجة إليه قليلة في زمانهم وأول من سن دعوة المبتدعة بالمجادلة إلى الحق علي ابن أبي طالب رضي الله عنه إذ بعث ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما إلى الخوارج فكلمهم فقال ما تنقمون على إمامكم قالوا قاتل ولم يسب ولم يغنم فقال ذلك في قتال الكفار أرأيتم لو سببت عائشة رضي الله عنها في سهم أحدكم أكنتم تستحلون منها ما تستحلون من ملككم وهي أمكم في نص الكتاب فقالوا لا فرجع منهم إلى الطاعة بمجادلته ألفان وروى أن الحسن ناظر قدريا فرجع عن القدر وناظر علي بن أبي طالب كرم الله وجهه رجلا من القدرية وناظر عبد الله بن مسعود رضي الله عنه يزيد بن عميرة في الإيمان قال عبد الله لو قلت إني مؤمن لقلت إني في الجنة فقال له يزيد بن عميرة يا صاحب رسول الله هذه زلة منك وهل الإيمان إلا أن تؤمن بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله والبعث والميزان وتقيم الصلاة والصوم والزكاة ولنا ذنوب لو نعلم أنها تغفر لنا لعلمنا أننا من أهل الجنة فمن أجل ذلك نقول إنا مؤمنون ولا نقول إنا من أهل الجنة فقال ابن مسعود صدقت والله إنها مني زلة فينبغي أن يقال كان خوضهم فيه قليلا لا كثيرا وقصيرا لا طويلا وعند الحاجة لا بطريق
Indeed, and He, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "And that was Our argument [hujjatuna] which We gave to Abraham against his people." And He, the Exalted, said in the story of Pharaoh: "And what is the Lord of the worlds?" up to His saying: "If you have come with something clear." And in summary, the Qur'an from its beginning to its end is a disputation [muhajjah] with the disbelievers. The foundation of the proofs of the theologians regarding Oneness [tawhid] is His saying, the Exalted: "If there were in them [the heavens and the earth] gods besides Allah, they would have been ruined." And regarding Prophethood: "And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our servant, then produce a surah like it." And regarding the Resurrection: "Say, 'He will give them life who produced them the first time.'" And other than these from the verses and proofs. And the Messengers, prayers of Allah be upon them, did not cease disputing [yuhajjuna] the deniers and arguing with them. He, the Exalted, said: "And argue with them in a way that is best." So the Companions, may Allah be pleased with them, also used to dispute [yuhajjuna] the deniers and argue, but only when necessary, and the need for it was little in their time. And the first to establish the invitation of the innovators through argument [mujadalah] to the truth was 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, when he sent Ibn 'Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, to the Khawarij, and he spoke to them. He said, "What do you find fault with regarding your Imam?" They said, "He fought but did not take captives nor take spoils." He said, "That is regarding fighting the disbelievers. Tell me, if 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, were taken captive in the share of one of you, would you deem lawful from her what you deem lawful from your spoils, while she is your mother according to the clear text of the Book?" They said, "No." So two thousand of them returned to obedience through his argument [mujadalatihi]. And it is narrated that Al-Hasan debated [nadhar] a Qadari, so he retracted from Qadr. And 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah honor his face, debated [nadhar] a man from the Qadariyyah. And 'Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, debated [nadhar] Yazid ibn 'Umayrah regarding faith [iman]. 'Abdullah said, "If I said I am a believer [mu'min], I would be saying I am in Paradise." Yazid ibn 'Umayrah said to him, "O companion of the Messenger of Allah, this is a slip from you. Is faith [iman] not but that you believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Resurrection, the Balance, and you establish the prayer, fasting, and zakah? And we have sins; if we knew they would be forgiven for us, we would know we are from the people of Paradise. It is for that reason we say we are believers [mu'minun] and we do not say we are from the people of Paradise." Ibn Mas'ud said, "You have spoken the truth, by Allah. It is indeed a slip from me." Therefore, it should be said: Their delving into it was little, not much; and short, not long; and when necessary, not as a method.

a.g: And We gave to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - all [of them] We guided. And Noah, We guided before; and among his descendants, David and Solomon and Job and Joseph and Moses and Aaron. Thus do We reward the doers of good.
And Zechariah and John and Jesus and Elias - and all were of the righteous.
And Ishmael and Elisha and Jonah and Lot - and all [of them] We preferred over the worlds.
And [some] among their fathers and their descendants and their brothers - and We chose them and We guided them to a straight path.
That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Allah, then worthless for them would be whatever they were doing.
Those are the ones to whom We gave the Scripture and authority and prophethood. But if the disbelievers deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not therein disbelievers.
Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so from their guidance take an example. Say, "I ask of you for this message no payment. It is not but a reminder for the worlds."

And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal when they said, "Allah did not reveal to a human being anything." Say, "Who revealed the Scripture that Moses brought as light and guidance to the people? You [Jews] make it into pages, disclosing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers." Say, "Allah [revealed it]." Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بل العاقل يأكل البقل ولا يسأل عن المبقلة، ومن يشتهي رؤية معشوقه يشغله عشقه عن أن يلتفت إلى أن رؤيته تخلق في عينه أو جبهته، بل يقصد الرؤيا ولذتها سواء كان ذلك بالعين أو غيرها، فإن العين محل وظرف لا نظر إليه ولا حكم له، والحق فيه أن القدرة الأزلية واسعة فلا يجوز أن نحكم عليها بالقصور عن أحد الأمرين، هذا في حكم الجواز، فأما الواقع في الآخرة من الجائزين فلا يدرك إلا بالسمع والحق[26] ما ظهر لأهل السنة والجماعة من شواهد الشرع أن ذلك يخلق في العين ليكون لفظ الرؤية والنظر، وسائر الألفاظ الواردة في الشرع مجري على ظاهره، إذ لا يجوز إزالة الظواهر إلا لضرورة والله تعالى أعلم. بيان الأسباب المقوية لحب الله تعالى اعلم أن أسعد الخلق حالاً في الآخرة أقواهم حباً لله تعالى، فإن الآخرة معناها القدوم على الله تعالى ودرك سعادة لقائه، وما أعظم نعيم المحب إذا قدم على محبوبه بعد طول شوقه! وتمكن من دوام مشاهدته أبد الآباد من غير منغص ومكدر ومن غير رقيب ومزاحم ومن غير خوف انقطاع! إلا أن هذا النعيم على قدر قوة الحب فكلما ازدادت المحبة ازدادت اللذة، وإنما يكتسب العبد حب الله تعالى في الدنيا وأصل الحب لا ينفك عنه مؤمن لأنه لا ينفك عن أصل المعرفة، وأما قوة الحب واستيلاؤه حتى ينتهي إلى الاستهتار الذي يسمى عشقاً فذلك ينفك عنه الأكثرون، وإنما يحصل ذلك بسببين: أحدهما قطع علائق الدنيا وإخراج حب غير الله من القلب، فإن القلب مثل الإناء لا يتسع للخل مثلاً ما لم يخرج منه الماء " ما جعل الله لرجل من قلبين في جوفه " وكمال الحب في أن يحب الله عز وجل بكل قلبه. وما دام يلتفت إلى غيره فزاوية من قلبه مشغولة بغيره. فبقدر ما يشغل بغير الله ينقص منه حب الله، وبقدر ما يبقى من الماء في الإناء ينقص من الخل المصبوب فيه. وإلى هذا التفريد والتجريد الإشارة بقوله تعالى: " قل الله ثم ذرهم في خوضهم"، وبقوله تعالى: " إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا " بل هو معنى قولك " لا إله إلا الله " أي معبود ولا محبوب سواه، فكل محبوب فإنه معبود، فإن العبد هو المقيد والمعبود هو المقيد به، وكل محب مقيد بما يحبه.
Indeed, the person of intellect [al-'aqil] eats the herb and does not inquire about the herb-garden. And whoever yearns to see his Beloved, his passionate love [ishq] preoccupies him from turning his attention to whether the vision is created in his eye or his forehead. Rather, he intends the vision and its delight, whether that is by the eye or otherwise. For the eye is a vessel and a container; there is no consideration of it, and it has no ruling. The truth in this is that the Eternal Power [al-Qudrah al-Azaliyyah] is vast, so it is not permissible for us to judge it as incapable of either of the two matters. This is regarding the ruling of permissibility. As for what is actualized in the Hereafter from among the permissible matters, it is not apprehended except by the revealed report [al-sam'], and the truth is what has become manifest to the People of the Sunnah and the Community from the evidences of the Sacred Law [shawahid al-shar']: that it is created in the eye so that the wording of 'vision' [ru'yah] and 'seeing' [nazar], and all the other terms mentioned in the Sacred Law, may be applied according to their apparent meaning. For it is not permissible to remove the apparent meanings except out of necessity. And God, the Exalted, knows best. **Clarification of the Causes that Strengthen the Love of God, the Exalted** Know that the happiest of creation in state in the Hereafter are the strongest of them in love [hubb] for God, the Exalted. For the meaning of the Hereafter is coming before God, the Exalted, and attaining the bliss of meeting Him. How immense is the bliss [na'im] of the lover when he comes before his Beloved after a long yearning! And he attains the permanence of witnessing Him [mushahadah] for all eternity, without any cause of vexation or disturbance, and without any overseer or rival, and without any fear of cessation! However, this bliss is according to the measure of the strength of the love [hubb]; whenever the love increases, the delight increases. The servant only acquires the love of God, the Exalted, in this world [al-dunya]. The foundation of love is inseparable from the believer, because it is inseparable from the foundation of knowledge [ma'rifah]. As for the strength of love and its domination until it reaches the rapturous passion which is called passionate love [ishq], that is what most people are separate from. That is only attained due to two causes: The first is severing the attachments of the world [ala'iq al-dunya] and expelling the love of other-than-God from the heart [qalb]. For the heart is like a vessel; it does not accommodate vinegar, for example, unless the water is removed from it. "God has not made for any man two hearts within his breast." The perfection of love is in loving God, the Mighty and Majestic, with all of his heart. As long as he turns his attention to other-than-Him, a corner of his heart is preoccupied with other-than-Him. To the extent he is preoccupied with other-than-God, the love of God diminishes from him. And to the extent water remains in the vessel, the vinegar poured into it diminishes. To this singling out [tafrid] and purification [tajrid] is the allusion in His statement, the Exalted: "Say, 'God,' then leave them in their discourse," and in His statement, the Exalted: "Indeed, those who have said, 'Our Lord is God,' and then remained steadfast." Rather, it is the meaning of your saying, "There is no god but God" [La ilaha illa Allah]—meaning, there is no object of worship [ma'bud] and no object of love [mahbub] except Him. For every object of love is an object of worship. For the servant [al-'abd] is the one bound, and the object of worship is what he is bound to. And every lover is bound by what he loves.

a.g: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are maintaining their prayers.

And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or says, "It has been inspired to me," while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, "I will reveal [something] like what Allah revealed." And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels extend their hands, [saying], "Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth and [that] you were, toward His verses, being arrogant."

[It will be said to them], "And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind you. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed that they were among you associates [of Allah]. It has [all] been severed between you, and lost from you is what you used to claim."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وفي هذه القيامة يكون العبد وحده وعندها يقال ﴿ ولقد جئتمونا فرادى كما خلقناكم أول مرة ﴾ {} وفيها يقال ﴿ كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا ﴾ {} أما في القيامة الكبرى الجامعة لكافة الخلائق فلا يكون وحده بل ربما يحاسب على ملأ من الخلق وفيها يساق المتقون إلى الجنة والمجرمون إلى النار زمرا لا آحادا والهول الأول هو هول القيامة الصغرى ولجميع أهوال القيامة الكبرى نظير في القيامة الصغرى مثل زلزلة الأرض مثلا فإن أرضك الخاصة بك تزلزل في الموت فإنك تعلم أن الزلزلة إذا نزلت ببلدة صدق أن يقال قد زلزلت أرضهم وإن لم تزلزل البلاد المحيطة بها بل لو زلزل مسكن الإنسان وحده فقد حصلت الزلزلة في حقه لأنه إنما يتضرر عند زلزلة جميع الارض بزلزلة مسكنه لا بزلزلة مسكن غيره فحصته من الزلزلة قد توفرت من غير نقصان.
Indeed, in this resurrection [qiyamah], the servant ['abd] will be alone, and at that time it will be said: **"And you have come to Us alone, as We created you the first time"** (6:94). And in it, it will be said: **"Sufficient is yourself this Day against you as a reckoner"** (17:14). As for the Greater Resurrection [al-qiyamah al-kubra], which gathers all of creation, he will not be alone; rather, he will perhaps be called to account before an assembly of creation. And in it, the righteous [muttaqun] will be driven to Paradise and the criminals [mujrimun] to the Fire in groups, not as individuals. The first terror [al-hawl al-awwal] is the terror of the Minor Resurrection [qiyamah al-sughra], and for all the terrors of the Greater Resurrection there is a counterpart in the Minor Resurrection. Like the quaking of the earth [zalzalah al-ard], for example. Indeed, your own specific earth [arduka al-khassah] quakes in death. For you know that when a quaking befalls a town, it is truthful to say their earth has quaked, even if the surrounding lands have not quaked. Nay, if a person's dwelling alone quakes, the quaking has occurred in his regard, because he is only harmed by the quaking of all the earth through the quaking of his own dwelling, not by the quaking of another's dwelling. Thus, his portion [hissah] of the quaking has been fulfilled completely, without any diminishment.

a.g: Indeed, Allah is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allah; so how are you deluded?
[He is] the cleaver of daybreak and has made the night for rest and the sun and moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الورد الأول: ما بين طلوع الصبح إلى طلوع الشمس وهو وقت شريف ويدل على شرفه وفضله إقسام الله تعالى به إذ قال: ﴿ والصبح إذا تنفس ﴾ {} وتمدحه به إذ قال: ﴿ فالق الإصباح ﴾ {} وقال تعالى: ﴿ قل أعوذ برب الفلق ﴾ {} وإظهاره القدرة بقبض الظل فيه إذ قال تعالى: ﴿ ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا ﴾ {} وهو وقت قبض ظل الليل ببسط نور الشمس وإرشاده الناس إلى التسبيح فيه بقوله تعالى: ﴿ فسبحان الله حين تمسون وحين تصبحون ﴾ {} وبقوله تعالى: ﴿ فسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ﴾ {} وقوله عز وجل: ﴿ ومن آناء الليل فسبح وأطراف النهار لعلك ترضى ﴾ {} وقوله تعالى: ﴿ واذكر اسم ربك بكرة وأصيلا ﴾ {}.
The First Portion [al-ward al-awwal]: From the rising of the dawn [subh] until the rising of the sun. It is a noble time [waqt sharif], and its nobility and virtue are indicated by God the Exalted swearing by it when He said: "And by the dawn [subh] when it breathes" (81:18), and by His praising it when He said: "He who splits the dawn [isbah]" (6:96), and when He said: "Say, 'I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak [falaq]'" (113:1). And He manifests His power in the drawing in of the shadow therein, when He the Exalted said: "Then We draw it in towards Ourselves, a gradual drawing in" (25:46). It is the time of drawing in the shadow of the night by spreading the light [nur] of the sun, and He guides people to glorify Him therein by His saying: "So glorify God when you reach the evening and when you rise at morn [tusbihun]" (30:17), and by His saying: "So glorify with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting" (50:39), and His saying, Mighty and Majestic: "And glorify Him during parts of the night and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied" (20:130), and His saying: "And remember the name of your Lord morning [bukratan] and evening [asila]" (76:25).

a.g: And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for a people who know.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن الطريق إلى الله تعالى مراقبة الأوقات وعمارتها بالأوراد على سبيل الدوام، ولذلك قال النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم: 'أحب عباد الله إلى الله الذين يراعون الشمس والقمر والأظلة لذكر الله تعالى'. وقد قال تعالى: ﴿ الشمس والقمر بحسبان ﴾، وقال تعالى: ﴿ ألم تر إلى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا ﴾، وقال تعالى: ﴿ والقمر قدرناه منازل ﴾، وقال تعالى: ﴿ وهو الذي جعل لكم النجوم لتهتدوا بها في ظلمات البر والبحر ﴾. فلا تظنن أن المقصود من سير الشمس والقمر بحسبان منظوم مرتب ومن خلق الظل والنور والنجوم أن يستعان بها على أمور الدنيا، بل لتعرف بها مقادير الأوقات فتشتغل فيها بالطاعات والتجارة للدار الآخرة، يدلك عليه قوله تعالى: ﴿ وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن أراد أن يذكر أو أراد شكورا ﴾، أي يخلف أحدهما الآخر ليتدارك في أحدهما ما فات في الآخر، وبين أن ذلك للذكر والشكر لا غير. وقال تعالى: ﴿ وجعلنا الليل والنهار آيتين فمحونا آية الليل وجعلنا آية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب ﴾، وإنما الفضل المبتغى هو الثواب والمغفرة.
Indeed, the path to God [Allah] the Exalted is the vigilant observance of times [awqat] and their cultivation through constant devotional acts [awrad] in a manner of continuity. For this reason, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'The servants of God most beloved to God are those who observe the sun and the moon and the shadows for the remembrance [dhikr] of God the Exalted.' And He the Exalted has said: "The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation [hisaban]" (6:96). And He the Exalted has said: "Have you not considered your Lord—how He extends the shadow? If He willed, He could have made it stationary. Then We made the sun for it an indicator. Then We hold it in hand, a gentle seizing" (25:45-46). And He the Exalted has said: "And the moon—We have determined for it phases [manazil]" (36:39). And He the Exalted has said: "And it is He who placed for you the stars that you may be guided by them through the darknesses [zulumat] of the land and sea" (6:97). So do not suppose that the purpose of the sun and the moon moving by a precise, ordered system, and of the creation of shadow and light and stars, is to seek aid through them for the affairs of the lower world [dunya]. Rather, it is so that you may know by them the measures of times [awqat] and thus occupy yourselves within them with acts of obedience [ta'at] and commerce for the Abode of the Hereafter [dar al-akhira]. What points you to this is His the Exalted's statement: "And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember [dhikr] or desires gratitude [shukr]" (25:62). That is, one succeeds the other so that what was missed in one may be recovered in the other. And He made clear that this is for remembrance [dhikr] and gratitude [shukr], and nothing else. And He the Exalted said: "And We have made the night and the day two signs [ayatayn]. Then We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty [fadl] from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [hisab]" (17:12). And the bounty [fadl] that is sought is reward [thawab] and forgiveness [maghfira].

a.g: And it is He who produced you from one soul and [gave you] a place of dwelling and of storage. We have detailed the signs for a people who understand.

And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We produce from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And [We produce] gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet varied. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
But they have attributed to Allah partners - the jinn, while He has created them - and have fabricated for Him sons and daughters. Exalted is He and high above what they describe
[He is] Originator of the heavens and the earth. How could He have a son when He does not have a companion and He created all things? And He is, of all things, Knowing.
That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.
Vision perceives Him not, but He perceives [all] vision; and He is the Subtle, the Acquainted.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الدنيا اعلم أن المدركات تنقسم إلى ما يدخل في الخيال، كالصور المتخيلة والأجسام المتلونة والمتشكلة من أشخاص الحيوان والنبات، وإلى ما لا يدخل في الخيال، كذات الله تعالى وكل ما ليس بجسم كالعلم والقدرة والإرادة وغيرها. فإذن الخيال أول الإدراك والرؤية هو الاستكمال لإدراك الخيال وهو غاية الكشف، وسمي ذلك رؤية لأنه غاية الكشف لا لأنه في العين. وإذا فهمت هذا في المتخيلات فاعلم أن المعلومات التي لا تتشكل أيضاً في الخيال لمعرفتها وإدراكها درجتان أحدهما أولى، والثانية استكمال لها. وبين الأولى والثانية من التفاوت في مزيد الكشف والإيضاح ما بين المتخيل والمرئي، فيسمى الثاني أيضاً بالإضافة إلى الأول مشاهدة ولقاء ورؤية. وهذه التسمية حتى لأن الرؤية سميت رؤية لأنها غاية الكشف، وكما أن سنة الله تعالى جارية بأن تطبيق الأجفان يمنع من تمام الكشف بالرؤية ويكون حجاباً بين البصر والمرئي، ولا بد من ارتفاع الحجب لحصول الرؤية. وما لم ترتفع كان الإدراك الحاصل مجرد التخيل فكذلك مقتضى سنة الله تعالى أن النفس ما دامت محجوبة بعوارض البدن ومقتضى الشهوات وما غلب عليها من الصفات البشرية، فإنها لا تنتهي إلى المشاهدة واللقاء في المعلومات الخارجة عن الخيال، بل هذه الحياة حجاب عنها بالضرورة كحجاب الأجفان عن رؤية الأبصار. ولذلك قال تعالى لموسى عليه السلام: " لن تراني " وقال تعالى " لا تدركه الأبصار " أي في الدنيا والصحيح أن رسول الله ﭬ ما رأى الله تعالى ليلة المعراج[22]. فإذا ارتفع الحجاب بالموت بقيت النفس ملوثة بكدورات الدنيا، غير منفكة عنها بالكلية وإن كانت متفاوتة، فمنها ما تراكم عليه الخبث والصدأ فصار كالمرآة التي فسد بطول تراكم الخبث جوهرها فلا تقبل الإصلاح والتصقيل، وهؤلاء هم المحجوبون عن ربهم أبد الآباد - نعوذ بالله من ذلك - ومنا ما لم ينته إلى حد الرين والطبع ولم يخرج عن قبول التزكية والتصقيل فيعرض على النار عرضاً يقمع منه الخبث الذي هو متدنس به، ويكون العرض على النار بقدر الحاجة إلى التزكية، وأقلها لحظة خفيفة وأقصاها حق المؤمنين - كما وردت به الأخبار- سبعة آلاف[23] سنة ولن ترتحل نفس عن هذا العالم إلا ويصحبها غبرة وكدورة ما، وإن قلت: ولذلك قال الله تعالى: " وإن منكم إلا واردها كان على ربك حتماً مقتضياً ثم ننجي الذين اتقوا ونذر الظالمين فيها جثياً " فكل نفس مستيقنة للورود على النار وغير مستيقنة للصدور عنها، فإذا أكمل الله تطهيرها وتزكيتها وبلغ الكتاب أجله ووقع الفراغ عن جملة ما وعد به الشرع من الحساب والعرض وغيره، ووافى استحقاق الجنة - وذلك وقت مبهم لم يطلع الله عليه أحداً من خلقه فإنه واقع بعد القيامة؛ ووقت القيامة مجهول - فعند ذلك يشتغل بصفائه ونقائه عن الكدورات حيث لا يرهق وجهه غبرة ولا قترة لأن فيه يتجلى الحق سبحانه وتعالى، فيتجلى له تجلياً يكون انكشاف تجليه بالإضافة إلى ما علمه كانكشاف تجلي المرآة بالإضافة إلى ما تخيله. وهذه المشاهدة والتجلي هي التي تسمى رؤية، فإذن الرؤية حق، بشرط أن لا يفهم من الرؤية استكمال الخيال في متخيل متصور مخصوص بجهة ومكان؛ فإن ذلك مما يتعالى عنه رب الأرباب علواً كبيراً، بل كما عرفته في الدنيا معرفة حقيقية تامة من غير تخيل وتصور وتقدير شكل وصورة، فتراه في الآخرة كذلك. بل أقول: المعرفة الحاصلة في الدنيا بعينها هي التي تستكمل فتبلغ كمال الكشف والوضوح
Indeed, know that perceptions [mudrakat] are divided into that which enters the imagination [khayal], such as imagined forms [suwar] and colored, shaped bodies [ajsam] of animal and plant individuals, and into that which does not enter the imagination [khayal], such as the Essence [dhat] of God, the Exalted, and all that is not a body [jism], like knowledge ['ilm], power [qudra], will [irada], and others. Therefore, the imagination [khayal] is the beginning of perception [idrak], and vision [ru'ya] is the completion [istikmal] of the perception [idrak] of the imagination [khayal], and it is the ultimate unveiling [kashf]. And that is called vision [ru'ya] because it is the ultimate unveiling [kashf], not because it is in the eye. And when you understand this regarding imaginable things, then know that the knowable things [ma'lumat] which also do not take form in the imagination [khayal] have two degrees for their knowledge [ma'rifa] and perception [idrak]: one is primary, and the second is a completion [istikmal] of it. And between the first and the second is a disparity in the increase of unveiling [kashf] and clarity [idah] like that between the imagined [mutakhayyal] and the seen [mar'i]. Thus, the second is also called, in relation to the first, witnessing [mushahada], meeting [liqa'], and vision [ru'ya]. And this naming is because vision [ru'ya] was called vision [ru'ya] because it is the ultimate unveiling [kashf]. And just as the custom [sunnah] of God, the Exalted, is established that the closing of the eyelids prevents the complete unveiling [kashf] through vision [ru'ya] and is a veil [hijab] between the sight [basar] and the seen [mar'i], and the veils [hujub] must be lifted for vision [ru'ya] to occur—and what is not lifted, the perception [idrak] that occurs is mere imagination [takhayyul]—so too, by the requirement of the custom [sunnah] of God, the Exalted, as long as the soul [nafs] is veiled [mahjuba] by the accidents ['awarid] of the body [badan] and the demands of the appetites [shahawat] and the human qualities [sifat] that dominate it, it does not attain witnessing [mushahada] and meeting [liqa'] in the knowable things [ma'lumat] outside the imagination [khayal]. Rather, this life [hayat] is necessarily a veil [hijab] over it, like the veil [hijab] of the eyelids over the vision [ru'ya] of sights [absar]. And for that reason, He, the Exalted, said to Moses, peace be upon him: "You will not see Me," and He, the Exalted, said: "Eyesights [absar] do not perceive Him"—meaning in this world [dunya]. And the correct position is that the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, did not see God, the Exalted, on the Night of the Ascension. So when the veil [hijab] is lifted by death, the soul [nafs] remains stained with the impurities [kudurat] of the world [dunya], not completely free from them, though they vary. Among them is that upon which filth [khabath] and rust [sada'] have accumulated, so it becomes like a mirror whose substance [jawhar] has been corrupted by the long accumulation of filth [khabath], so it does not accept rectification [islah] and polishing [tasqil]. These are the ones veiled [mahjubun] from their Lord for all eternity—we seek refuge in God from that. And among us is that which has not reached the limit of the stain [rayn] and sealing [tab'] and has not left the capacity for purification [tazkiya] and polishing [tasqil]. So it is presented to the Fire [nar] in a presentation that suppresses from it the filth [khabath] with which it is soiled. And the presentation to the Fire [nar] is according to the need for purification [tazkiya], the least of it being a light moment, and the longest of it—as the reports have stated—being seven thousand years for the believers. And no soul [nafs] will depart from this world ['alam] except that it is accompanied by some dust [ghubra] and impurity [kudura], even if little. And for that reason, God, the Exalted, said: "And there is none of you but will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed. Then We will save those who feared God and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees." So every soul [nafs] is certain of arriving at the Fire [nar] and not certain of emerging from it. So when God completes its purification [tathir] and its purification [tazkiya], and the Book reaches its term, and the completion occurs of all that the Law [shar'] promised of the Reckoning [hisab], the Presentation ['ard], and other things, and the entitlement to Paradise [janna] arrives—and that is an ambiguous time [waqt mubham] which God has not informed any of His creation about, for it occurs after the Resurrection [qiyama]; and the time of the Resurrection [qiyama] is unknown—then at that time, it becomes occupied with its purity [safa'] and its freedom from impurities [kudurat], where no dust [ghubra] or darkness [qatra] covers its face. For in it, the Truth [al-Haqq], glory and exaltation be to Him, is manifested [yatajalla]. So He is manifested [yatajalla] to it with a manifestation [tajalli] whose unveiling [inkishaf] in relation to what it knew is like the unveiling [inkishaf] of the mirror's manifestation [tajalli] in relation to what it imagined [takhayyala]. And this witnessing [mushahada] and manifestation [tajalli] is what is called vision [ru'ya]. Therefore, vision [ru'ya] is true [haqq], provided that what is understood from vision [ru'ya] is not the completion [istikmal] of the imagination [khayal] in a specific, imagined [mutakhayyal], conceived [mutasawwar] thing, particularized by direction [jiha] and place [makan]; for that is something from which the Lord of lords is greatly exalted. Rather, just as you knew Him in the world [dunya] with a true [haqiqiya], complete knowledge [ma'rifa] without imagination [takhayyul], conception [tasawwur], and estimation of shape [shakl] and form [sura], so you will see Him in the Hereafter [akhira] likewise. Rather, I say: The very knowledge [ma'rifa] attained in the world [dunya] is what is completed [istikmal], so it reaches the perfection [kamal] of unveiling [kashf] and clarity [wuduh].

a.g: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see does so for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever is blind [does harm] against it. And [say], "I am not a guardian over you."
And thus do We diversify the verses so the disbelievers will say, "You have studied," and so We may make the Qur'an clear for a people who know.
Follow, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allah.
But if Allah had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a manager over them.

And do not insult those they invoke other than Allah, lest they insult Allah in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وأن يقصد به حسم باب الغيبة عن المغتابين إذا اغتابوه بالروائح الكريهة فيعصون الله بسببه فمن تعرض للغيبة وهو قادر على الاحتراز منها فهو شريك في تلك المعصية كما قيل إذا ترحلت عن قوم وقد قدروا ان لا تفارقهم فالراحلون هم وقال الله تعالى ولا تسبوا الذين يدعون من دون الله فيسبوا الله عدوا بغير علم أشار به إلى أن التسبب إلى الشر شر وأن يقصد به معالجة دماغه لتزيد به فطنته وذكاؤه ويسهل عليه درك مهمات دينه بالفكر فقد قال الشافعي رحمه الله من طاب ريحه زاد عقله فهذا وأمثاله من النيات لا يعجز الفقيه عنها إذا كانت تجارة الآخرة وطلب الخير غالبة على قلبه وإذا لم يغلب على قلبه إلا نعيم الدنيا لم تحضره هذه النيات وإن ذكرت له لم ينبعث لها قلبه فلا يكون معه منها إلا حديث النفس وليس ذلك من النية في شىء والمباحات كثيرة ولا يمكن إحصاء النيات فيها فقس بهذا الواحد ما عداه.
And God the Exalted said: "And do not insult those they call upon besides God, lest they insult God in enmity without knowledge [bi-ghayri 'ilm]." He pointed by this to the fact that being a means to evil is evil.

a.g: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, "The signs are only with Allah." And what will make you perceive that even if a sign came, they would not believe.
And We will turn away their hearts and their eyes just as they refused to believe in it the first time. And We will leave them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بيان سرعة تقلب القلب وانقسام القلوب في التغير والثبات اعلم أن القلب كما ذكرناه تكتنفه الصفات التي ذكرناها وتنصب إليه الآثار والأحوال من الأبواب التي وصفناها فكأنه هدف يصاب على الدوام من كل جانب فإذا أصابه شيء يتأثر به أصابه من جانب آخر ما يضاده فتتغير صفته فإن نزل به الشيطان فدعاه إلى الهوى نزل به الملك وصرفه عنه وإن جذبه شيطان إلى شر جذبه شيطان آخر إلى غيره وإن جذبه ملك إلى خير جذبه آخر إلى غيره فتارة يكون متنازعا بين ملكين وتارة بين شيطانين وتارة بين ملك وشيطان لا يكون قط مهملا وإليه الإشارة بقوله تعالى ونقلب أفئدتهم وأبصارهم ولاطلاع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم على عجيب صنع الله تعالى في عجائب القلب وتقلبه كان يحلف به فيقول لا ومقلب القلوب وكان كثيرا ما يقول يا مقلب القلوب ثبت قلبي على دينك قالوا أو تخاف يا رسول الله قال وما يؤمنني والقلب بين أصبعين من أصابع الرحمن يقلبه كيف يشاء وفي لفظ آخر إن شاء أن يقيمه أقامه وإن شاء أن يزيغه أزاغه
Indeed, an exposition of the swift turning of the heart [qalb] and the division of hearts in changing and remaining firm. Know that the heart [qalb], as We have mentioned, is enveloped by the attributes We have described, and effects [athar] and states [ahwal] pour into it from the gates We have depicted. So it is as if it is a target, struck perpetually from every side. If something strikes it and it is affected by it, it is then struck from another side by what opposes it, and so its attribute changes. If a satan [shaytan] descends upon it, calling it to caprice [hawa], a king [malak] descends upon it, turning it away from that. And if one satan pulls it towards an evil, another satan pulls it towards another. And if a king pulls it towards a good, another pulls it towards another. So at times it is contested between two kings, and at times between two satans, and at times between a king and a satan. It is never left neglected. And to this is the allusion in His, the Exalted's, saying: "And We turn over their hearts [af'idah] and their sights." And because the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, had insight into the wondrous making of God, the Exalted, in the marvels of the heart [qalb] and its turning, he would swear by it, saying: "No, by the Turner of hearts [muqallib al-qulub]." And he would often say: "O Turner of hearts [muqallib al-qulub], make my heart [qalb] firm upon Your religion [din]." They said: "Do you fear, O Messenger of God?" He said: "And what makes me secure? The heart [qalb] is between two fingers of the fingers of the All-Merciful [al-Rahman]; He turns it as He wills." And in another wording: "If He wills to establish it, He establishes it, and if He wills to make it deviate, He makes it deviate."

a.g: And even if We had sent down to them the angels [with the message] and the dead spoke to them [of it] and We gathered together every [created] thing in front of them, they would not believe unless Allah should will. But most of them, [of that], are ignorant.

And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and that which they invent.
And [it is] so the hearts of those who disbelieve in the Hereafter will incline toward it and that they will be satisfied with it and that they will commit that which they are committing.

[Say], "Then is it other than Allah I should seek as judge while it is He who has revealed to you the Book explained in detail?" And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth, so never be among the doubters.
And the word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and in justice. None can alter His words, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقال بعضهم: لو عرفت واحدا بالتوحيد خمسين سنة ثم حال بيني وبينه سارية ومات لم أحكم أنه مات على التوحيد. وقيل في قوله تعالى: ﴿ وتمت كلمات ربك صدقا وعدلا ﴾ صدقا لمن مات على الإيمان وعدلا لمن مات على الشرك.
Indeed, some have said: "If I knew a man by his declaration of Oneness [tawhid] for fifty years, and then a pillar [sariya] came between me and him and he died, I would not judge that he died upon Oneness [tawhid]." And it is said concerning His Exalted statement: "And the word of your Lord is perfected in truth and justice [sidqan wa 'adlan]" — truth [sidq] for the one who dies upon faith [iman], and justice ['adl] for the one who dies upon association [shirk].

a.g: And if you obey most of those upon the earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
So eat of that [meat] upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His verses.

And why should you not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled. And indeed do many lead [others] astray through their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
And leave what is apparent of sin and what is concealed thereof. Indeed, those who earn [blame for] sin will be recompensed for that which they used to commit.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فإذن قد أسبغ الله تعالى نعمه عليك ظاهرة وباطنة ثم قال: ﴿ وذروا ظاهر الإثم وباطنه ﴾ فترك باطن الإثم مما لا يعرفه الخلق من الحسد وسوء الظن والبدعة وإضمار الشر للناس إلى غير ذلك من آثام القلوب هو الشكر للنعم الباطنة وترك الإثم الظاهر بالجوارح شكر للنعمة الظاهرة.
Indeed, God the Exalted has poured forth His blessings [ni'am] upon you, both the outward [zahirah] and the inward [batinah]. Then He said: "And abandon sin [ithm], its outward [zahir] and its inward [batin]." Therefore, abandoning the inward [batin] of sin [ithm]—that which the creation does not know, such as envy [hasad], ill thoughts [su' al-zann], innovation [bid'ah], and harboring malice [sharr] for people, and other such sins [atham] of the hearts [qulub]—this is gratitude [shukr] for the inward [batinah] blessings [ni'am]. And abandoning the outward [zahir] sin [ithm] with the limbs [jawarih] is gratitude [shukr] for the outward [zahirah] blessing [ni'mah].

a.g: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the devils inspire their allies [among men] to dispute with you. And if you were to obey them, indeed, you would be associators [of others with Him].

And is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus it has been made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they were doing.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
والهداية الثالثة وراء الثانية وهو النور الذى يشرق في عالم النبوة والولاية بعد كمال المجاهدة فيهتدى بها إلا ما لا يهتدى إليه بالعقل الذى يحصل به التكليف وإمكان تعلم العلوم وهو الهوى المطلق وما عداه حجاب له ومقدمات وهو الذى شرفه الله تعالى بتخصيص الإضافة إليه وإن كان الكل من جهته تعالى فقال تعالى: ﴿ قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى ﴾ {} وهو المسمى حياة في قوله تعالى: ﴿ أو من كان ميتا فأحييناه وجعلنا له نورا يمشى به في الناس ﴾ {} والمعنى بقوله تعالى: ﴿ أفمن شرح الله صدره للإسلام فهو على نور من ربه ﴾ {}
Indeed, the third guidance [hudā] is beyond the second, and it is the light [nūr] that shines in the realm of prophethood [nubuwwa] and sainthood [wilāya] after the perfection of spiritual struggle [mujāhada]. One is guided by it to that which cannot be guided to by the intellect [‘aql]—the intellect by which one becomes subject to divine obligation [taklīf] and by which it is possible to learn the sciences. And that [which is beyond the intellect] is the absolute desire [al-hawā al-mutlaq], and everything else is a veil [hijāb] for it and its prerequisites. And it is that which God, the Exalted, honored by specifying its attribution to Him, even though all of it is from His side, the Exalted. So He, the Exalted, said: "Say, 'Indeed, the guidance of God is the guidance.'" And it is what is named 'life' [ḥayāt] in His saying, the Exalted: "Or is one who was dead, and We gave him life and made for him a light by which to walk among the people...?"
